Reviews.Title: “easy access to u of p hospital”
Reviews.Author: Joseph I
Reviews.Content: I needed surgery and didn't want my wife to have to worry about traffic or parking. The hotel has a bridge directly to the hospital! The room was clean and, although they could use an upgrading we were safe and secure. Several restaurants delivered to the room and more were a bit of a walk but still doable. Mind you it is not a 5star, but you will be safe, with secure, reasonable, parking. I would recommend this hotel for any hospital business, particularly for those not familiar with the city.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, basic accomodations if you have to stay close to the hospital(s).”
Reviews.Author: respiterri
Reviews.Content: We read some not so great reviews and were leary. However, we travel a lot.....for pleasure.....and have visited 47 states and stayed in a wide variety of accomodations. So when the rubber met the road as they say and we needed to spend the night while a loved one was in the ICU across the street we figured we would give it a try. We have stayed in many better, for less money, and we have stayed in many worse for more money. The bottom line is......the room had 2 double beds which were comfortable but not luxurious....nor were they sagging in the middle...the room is dated and not particularly clean, older carpet, old fixtures in the bathroom...it served our purpose well...hotels in Phila (or many cities) are pricey. This one was moderate, $145 night hospital rate plus $10 parking (good til midnite the next day) they only have 40 rooms so if they made it cheaper they would sell out I fear.....there was a coffee maker in room and a sandwich shop downstairs...only real complaint was a bit dirty and needs updating. We were glad they were there when we needed them......

Reviews.Title: “Towers are a saving grace”
Reviews.Author: Rob C
Reviews.Content: My father was undergoing open heart surgery. I read reviews and was very sceptical, "DONT BE". The Towers are fine. They provide a close and convenient access to the hospital or Childrens Hospital at a very resonable rate. It is safe, clean and very convenient. You can access the hospital ICU 24 hrs a day. Parking is safe, and the Towers provide passes so that you can go in and out of the parking garage without paying EXTRA cash.You cant ask for a better place to stay while you are remaining close to your loved one. The staff at the Towers were very helpful. We had pre-arranged to have a desent ref-freezer in the room, a microwave and coffee maker. If you stay anywhere else, you have to fight traffic and the like. The hallways are clean as noted above, and the room and bathroom were more than acceptable. This is not a five star hotel, HOWEVER it is not as bad as the other reviews state. I'm in Law Enforcement, and if I thought this hotel was the least a dump, I would not have let my mother(80 yrs old) stay here. The rugs have been replaced by the way, and the beds and the like are great and changed daily by the Towers maid staffing. This is a no brainer when you need to be close to your loved one. While at the Towers, I interacted with doctor's that spent the night on the same floor as I was on, and they had no problem with the accomadations... Your not taking a chance if you stay here. Roving security officers also patrol the floors occupied by hotel guests. I stayed eight days without a problem. (11-29-11)

Reviews.Title: “beautful”
Reviews.Author: Amanda K
Reviews.Content: loved the view, love the food,loved the rooms.. PERFECT

Reviews.Title: “This place is extortion!”
Reviews.Author: butr4what
Reviews.Content: This place is awful. My father was in the ICU at HUP so we stayed here for convenience (2 min walk to hospital across sky bridge). If we hadn't been in a life or death situation, there is no way we would have stayed. I realize that you're not going to get a 4 star hotel for $150 a night but I've stayed in cheap motels that were a lot nicer. The staff was rude and unhelpful, the ceiling in the bathroom was caving in, wallpaper was peeling, sheets were worn and stained, and they only bothered to replace or towels and make our beds 3 times in our 8 night stay. Most of the people staying here are in crisis mode and it is sad that they are being taken advantage of by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OMG...Dont' stay here unless is an emergency!”
Reviews.Author: dcmuseumlover
Reviews.Content: My child was in chop for 6 weeks.I spent my first two weeks at the Sheraton and Penn tower.Both were very disappointing to say the least. The Penn Tower was awful.The staff was rude...snide and non accomodating.The whole place was weird I felt like I was in the Twilight zone.It is old and stinky!! My child was dying in the children's hosp. and these people treated me so bad....Overpriced and disgusting! NO way would I stay there again. There should be a law againest this type of place...highway robbery!!!!! There is no wi fi and no amenities no room service or anything! I need towels and I had to wake up the sleeping clerk to get me some haha!!! I had no choice but to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Only Redeeming Feature is access to Hospital and Al”
Reviews.Author: Fly_d_Skies
Reviews.Content: This hotel badly needs to be gutted and brought from the dark ages to modernity. The only redeeming feature is the fact that it is quite convenient for the Hospital at the University of Pennsslvania which is accessed by a walkway. Al the porter is the other redeeming feature. Advice: Use only if you need access to the hospital, and make the stay as short as possible!

Reviews.Title: “Stay only if you need to be near the hospital!”
Reviews.Author: Ethanbrody
Reviews.Content: My father had open heart surgery and mother and I are not familiar with Philadelphia, so we opted to stay here for the night of his surgery. The hotel itself is located on Penn Hospital grounds, so it was very convenient but you pay for that!!!! I've stayed at some less than three star places, but this was probably a two star in my book. With a three star price tag per night. Location gets you a stay for over $150 per night. I know it's not a vacation destination, but that's literally highway robbery! Rooms and decor were straight outta the 80's and the beds were not comfy at all. Bathroom was kind of dark and moldy and the water was not hot at all!!! Warm if that. Stay only if you must.

Reviews.Title: “Needs refreshing and updating...”
Reviews.Author: JimFromJersey
Reviews.Content: As many reviews state, if you have a friend or relative in University of Pennsylvania Hospital and want to be right there for them, this is the place to stay. The hotel connects directly to the Silverstein Pavillion via a skywalk. The rooms are spacious. The rates in my opinion are very fair in today's hotel market. As another reviewer stated, I found the rooms to be clean. However, the bathrooms are pretty beat up and in need of replacement. Being involved in construction, I can state that the hardware used when these rooms were built wasn't all that good to start with and it hasn't withstood the test of time all that well. There are cracks in the vanity sinks. The cracks stain and can't be cleaned. This makes them appear to be dirty. The tubs have been refinished and the new finish is peeling off. My shower faucet only provided extremely hot water that could not be tempered at all. I stood as far back as I could to avoid being burned. In short, Penn Tower management - If you are reading this... You shut shut down these rooms one at a time and replace the bathrooms. Everything else about this hotel is at the very least adequate and can't be beat in regards to location and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but old”
Reviews.Author: garfmom
Reviews.Content: We found our room to be clean and in order. While the sheets were clean and the mattresses comfortable, the blankets were old & scratchy. There were no amenities to speak of, we chose the hotel for it's proximity to University of Pennsylvania. The heat & a/c worked but they were somewhat difficult to fully control. This hotel was the best price in our desired location. While it was not a great hotel, it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful for what was needed”
Reviews.Author: Portulacca
Reviews.Content: My husband needed heart surgery at Presbyterian and this hotel was the most reasonable hotel nearby even with the cost of a taxi to Presbyterian, it was still more reasonable than other hotels, it was clean, the room temperature could be adjusted easily, the staff was warm & helpful, and the location was excellent. There is a restaurant in the building which was fine, a McDonald's across the street open 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “If you have a relative at HUP and you want to be able to get there fast, this is your place....”
Reviews.Author: noplacelikehome1715
Reviews.Content: ...if you are looking for a vacation retreat, keep looking... Penn Tower is only a short indoor walk away from the hospital and having spent 8 long, hot summer days with a relatvie at HUP,it was a good choice for me, rather than hoofing it blocks and blocks to another hotel in the scorching heat. The room was big, the air conditioner was strong and despite what I read in other reviews, all was clean and I didn't see any bugs... My one complaint would be the temperature of the water in the bathroom..."lukewarm" doesn't cut it after you spend 8 or 9 hours in a hospital room... If you are in town looking to experience the city, go elsewhere...if you are looking to survive a family member's hospital stay at the closest proximity possible, this is the place. (You will not starve despite the lack of dining options...there is a good sandwich shop on the ground floor and the hospital food is better than you'd think...)

Reviews.Title: “Patient Family”
Reviews.Author: MBarbour
Reviews.Content: Terrible!!! Had a long day getting family member to hospital, needed a good night sleep and we got to the hotel to find it unclean: BUGS IN THE BED, used bedding, floors weren't vaccumed etc. VERY unsatisfied, left the room immediately!

Reviews.Title: “Thank Goodness for Penn Tower Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PENNHAPPY
Reviews.Content: My father recently spent 2 weeks in HUP for open heart surgery. My mother stayed at the Penn Tower Hotel for 2 weeks! What a relief it was for her to be able to stay that close to the hospital (and her husband) and not have to worry about walking city blocks, in all kinds of weather, all hours of the day and night. At times there were family members with her, but for the most part she was alone and felt perfectly safe traveling back and forth through the walkway. The staff was friendly and helpful. My mother also found support through other families that she met in the elevators that were going through the same fears and anxiety as she was. I hope the Penn Tower Hotel continues to service the families of loved ones at HUP and CHOP for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty”
Reviews.Author: gosomewhereelse123
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t know how these people sleep at night!!! This hotel takes advantage of the fact that loved ones are ill and you want to be close. I have just returned home from this hell hole, and never write reviews but I feel compelled to do so at this time. This hotel is filthy, the carpet was not vacuumed the linens are stained and grey, finger prints all over the mirrors that had not been cleaned off, doors do not work well had my card keyed several times. They charge $ 145.00 a night and that is the hospital rate I believe the regular rate is $ 179.00 a night. This hotel is gross at best. This place is not worth $ 30.00 a night. Go to the Hilton or Sheraton . The Hilton is really nice and less money. Unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “If you just want a place to sleep near the hospital, this is it.”
Reviews.Author: CheriScha
Reviews.Content: My father was in HUP for an emergency double bypass, and after spending two nights in the SICU family room, we decided to stay the night at the hotel. The price is disgustingly outrageous for what you get.. $145.00 a night. And thatâ€™s the â€œHUP discount â€œ rate. This doesnâ€™t include parking. The rooms are extremely basic. Two double beds are all they have. Thereâ€™s no room service, however there is an extremely overpriced sandwich shop on the ground floor if you really get hungry, or McDonalds across the street. No vending machine or ice machine on the floor I was on, despite the ice bucket that was provided to us. The bathrooms are very small and not very clean, with a half used roll of toilet paper on the dispenser, and only hand towels on the bath rack for use. The room also smelled strange, like body odor. The staff was pleasant, however I had to go back two times because the key card didnâ€™t work, quite nerve wracking after all day worrying at the hospital to come â€œhomeâ€� to not being able to get in. The one saving grace was the absolutely stunning view of the city and University stadium. We ended up checking out after only one night and staying in the family room the rest of the time. All and all, this hotel should be ashamed of itself for the price gouging of visitors and family members of people in the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Good for what it is meant for!”
Reviews.Author: Travel4moi
Reviews.Content: Bottom line...this hotel was a savior for when our loved one was in the hospital for an extended period of time. It was clean and the beds were comfortable. The hotel is directly connected with an enclosed walkway to the hospital with no need to cross the very busy 34th street or brave the elements. It is the closest hotel BY FAR which was perfect for my elderly mother to walk back and forth. The rates for when you are there for a patient are very very reasonable, they have someone to help with bags, a parking lot with dicounted parking. I highly recommend this hotel if you are staying there because of a loved on in the hospital. Is it the Four Season? No. Is it a Sheraton? No. Is it clean, comfortable, and resonable? YES YES YES.

Reviews.Title: “Choose another hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrema
Reviews.Content: The "service" is the worst I've ever experienced; the rooms have an old, tired, and dirty feel. The word is they are tearing the tower down in the near future, and not a minute too soon. My son, daughter and I stayed here for a few days while visiting a family member in the excellent Hospital of the University of PA (HUP) which is across the street and attached by an enclosed walkway. There are only two floors of the tower that are used as a hotel; the rest is an office building and owned, I believe, by HUP. This "hotel" really is a disgrace. I would only stay here again if I absolutely had to be going to and from the hospital at night. It probably is safer than walking the streets around the hospital. However, after discovering how bad this place is, we checked out and stayed for about 5 days at the very nice Inn at Penn, a Hilton, which is just a few blocks from the hospital. I think they offer a hospital rate most of the time. I just made sure that my visitng hours were timed with lots of foot traffic on the streets and vehicle traffic on the roads around. The University of Penn's campus is right there, but they have had some crime problems in the past and now have a couple of campus guards on most corners. Still, even with this added safety factor, it's not the best place to be walking at night. Bottom line: I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone unless safety is the ONLY concern.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Safe/Secure and Protected”
Reviews.Author: Jayne0655
Reviews.Content: Even though the reviews were not good, I decided to go with the convenience and security of staying attached to the hospital. I was staying two nights while my husband was hospitalized for surgery. We left home at 4 a.m. to be at the hospital at 6 a.m. It was hours between recovery and being moved to a room. I was able to check in to the hotel and take a nap. I never had to worry about my car, the staff was gracious and the bell-man walked me to my car the day of discharge and actually moved it close to the elevator for me. Not the Hyatt, but a god-send for me.

Reviews.Title: “Winers & Cry Babies!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BIGFOOTER125
Reviews.Content: PEOPLE!!!! This Hotel is Excellent when a loved one is in HUP!!!! My wife was there for three days for surgery. We live 90 minutes away, so I choose to stay in Philly. The bad reviews almost made me find another hotel, and Iâ€™m glad I DIDNâ€™T!! The Hotel is connected to the hospital by an enclosed walkway over the road. I didnâ€™t even have to wear a coat!! My room was CLEAN! DID NOT SMELL! The parking was only $10 per day, compared to $40 at the nearby Hilton family hotel. Anyone should not be afraid to stay at Penn Tower. YOU'RE NOT ON VACATION!!!! There are places to eat. The hospital has a cafeteria. I could stay with my wife till visitors had to leave at 8:00PM and just walk back to my room. Well priced! Convenient! STAY THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: PoppiOxfordCT
Reviews.Content: We came to be close to our family at the time of our grandson's cranial operation at CHOP. We read the reviews written by others prior to our arrival but were not deterred by the negative comments. The hotel staff was most friendly and accomidating. The facility was very clean and pleasant. The fact that it is adjacent to the Childrens Hospital was a decided plus. For an inercity hotel the price is right. If one wants to stay for the amineties of a full service hotel, they should try another. If they want to be close to the child and the family, THIS IS THE Place

Reviews.Title: “Hotel worth choosing if a loved one is admitted to the Univ. of Penn Hospital”
Reviews.Author: jend05
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Penn Tower Hotel for two weeks when my Dad was admitted to the Univ. of Penn Hospital. The price is high for what the hotel offers, but the convienience of the hotel to the hospital was worth the price to have my Mom close. The room was decent. The bathroom was dirty, the sink was cracked & filthy. The towels didn't always have a fresh smell. The bedsheet was torn and there was no fitted sheet on the beds...just flat sheets. The fire alarm went off at 1am. My family along w/about 8 other people ran down 18 flights of stairs. Once outside we were told it was a false alarm. No one checked the floors...they just knew someone accidently pulled the alarm. My Grandmother had to sit before taking the elevator back up to the room because she was tired. One of the security guards said 'why did they even leave their room - no one told them to do that. The alarm says to wait in the stairwell for directions.' Yes, that's what Im going to do...Im going to put my trust in these people - right. The cleaning ladies were very nice. The staff at the desk were not always the most pleasant. I was under the impression that we would receive an extended stay discount..meaning after we stayed 5 consecutive days we would receive a lower rate. When I checked out I was told that they no longer offer that perk. I left two messages for the manager to call me with no returned call. I finally called again and was able to talk to her. She said they haven't offered that for a year now. We paid $165.00 (includes tax) for 10 days....thats a pretty hefty bill for a family who has a father in the hospital and will now have lots of medical bills. Like I said, the only good thing about this hotel is the convienience of being close to your loved one who is staying in the hospital.

Reviews.Title: “Got The Job Done”
Reviews.Author: khick555555555
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not the nicest of places but it got the job done and was walking distance of the nearby Penn Hospital. Even though some things didn't work, it definitely made up for it with its breathtaking views of the skyline of the city of Philadelphia and its view of Franklin Field. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the convenience!!”
Reviews.Author: NurseandDoc
Reviews.Content: Being from out of the area, I don't care how negative the reviews are for this hotel, it has been a lifesaver for us this winter! With the bad weather and several stages of surgery I've had to go through, we have been very thankful for a hotel so close that we could stay the night and be ready for surgery early the next day. It was clean, granted the cakes of soap were the little size and the towels weren't the kind you find in a 5 star hotel, but it was sufficient for a nights stay whenever we need it. It is a clean basic hotel and what else matters. Please know this review is coming from a nurse (me) and a doctor (husband) who are used to traveling and staying in some of the best hotels. But when it comes to what I've been going through, this hotel has certainly met our needs. So you can't get many channels on the TV, so read a book! If your room looks dirty to you, ask to move to another room. I'm sure they will accomodate you, although as I said we have had no complaints. We went in knowing that our priority is my surgical service and the convenience this hotel offers for it. We knew it would not offer amenities we were used to, but that all pales when you're using it for a life/death surgery. I am hoping they keep the two floor hotel, upgrade it as needed and keep it handy for those of us who have to travel a distance, so we can spend a restful night before surgery. I would hate to see it turned into more office space when it meets the needs of us who can appreciate a clean basic room!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE IT"S THE WORSE THING SINCE ROACHES”
Reviews.Author: Rock212
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel looks great. Thats were it ends I was supiciuos when I got on the elevator because it had an ordor. The front desk did'nt look like your typical front desk. The staff was very cold and acted as if they didn't want to be bother. I arrived around 1:00pm hoping I could check in eary, Didn't happen. The rooms were neat but had a smell of stealness the bed was lumby and the TV was so old it had knobs. at night you can here rats or mices in the walls, I informed the front desk and they just blew my off. They billed me twice on my credit card and 3 months later it has not been resolve. I beg you don't stay there. YOU WERE WARNED...........

Reviews.Title: “Should be closed now”
Reviews.Author: sportsfan27
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at Penn Towers before when my husband had to be at the University Hospital, and it was always comfortable and very convenient. What a change this time! The two bedside lamps didn't work and the TV volume was so low we couldn't hear so we called for maintenance. They fixed the lamps but couldn't do anything about the TV. To watch our favorite show we sat about two feet away from the set. An arm was about to fall off one of the chairs which could be dangerous for an elderly person (and who else stays there?) There was a holder for the hair dryer but no dryer. There are extra charges for refrigerator, microwave, even calling an 800 number! The room was fairly clean and the bed was comfortable but otherwise our stay was terrible. For this we paid the "patient rate" of $145 plus tax plus $10 parking. Maintenance said the hospital owns the building and the two hotel floors will be taken over for offices soon. That's good because we'd hate to see anyone else waste their money on this place.

Reviews.Title: “Background on Penn Tower Hotel”
Reviews.Author: vmsPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: As an FYI to travelers, Penn Tower Hotel really is not functioning as a hotel. There are about 1.5 floors out of 21 that are still hotel rooms. The rest of the hotel is a medical center. The hotel does not have room service, has a small coffee bar that is only open until 2:30 in the afternoon and a gift shop that is pretty much like most medical center gift shops. The elevators are crowded and slow, housekeeping is minimal for hotel rooms and the building overall is VERY loud. PennStar medi-lift chopper hovers on the side of the building quite a few times every day, major construction is going on so there is a lot of noise and traffic, there is very little parking and if you can get it, be prepared to pay steep prices and there is at least one fire drill a week. This is the perfect location if you don't care about being pampered since it is close to CHOP and HUP. If you are expecting to experience a traditional hotel, this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “The worse ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fosterclan06
Reviews.Content: We had to go to Children's Hospital for our son and had 3 other children with us (4 in total). Booked both rooms MONTHS in advance. They didn't have the other room reservations, the showers were filthy, barely any towels, channels on the tvs were few. It was clearly seen that the cleaning service did the bare min. We had do not disturb signs on the doors and yet they felt the need to knock and try to get in. Next time we get a room at the Ronald Mc Donald house, there you have to help with some of the work but its much nicer to stay at and the people are nice to you!

Reviews.Title: “Great change for the better”
Reviews.Author: zimwow
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently redecorated--very clean. One negative however is they did away with room service and closed the in-house restaurants. No big deal--We went to La Veranda and had a great meal---

Reviews.Title: “Parking cash only”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a few years ago and wondered how they stayed in business, but rememeber that it IS run by an Academic Institute of Higher Learning. Ever been to a dorm? A captive, albeit suffering crowd from the hospital helps I guess. Parking here is cash only if you pay at the ramp. Who works on a cash only basis anymore, unless you don't want to report income? Move into the 90's people, credit cards would be a start. Self pay macnihes like most medical facilites would be even better to free up the exits.

Reviews.Title: “Glad I didn't cancel”
Reviews.Author: GrandmaMartinsburgWV
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on Penn Tower, I seriously considered canceling my reservation for the week when my grandson would be at CHOP. It seemed to be so helpful to have a room directly across the street so after talking with a manager I decided to keep the reservation and take my chances. I am so thankful I did. The hotel is old and many things are in need of renovation. It is no longer a full service hotel but the staff is very courteous and helpful. The beds were comfortable and linens were changed every day. The bathroom did need repairs (cracked sink, very slow running water in the shower were the biggest problems) but the tile floor was very clean. The view of the UPENN campus as well as center city skyline was wonderful. The archeology museum right next door would be great for spending many hours if one had the time. Dial up internet is available. The TV is not premium but local stations provide news and weather, etc. They have a hair dryer, iron and board, coffee pot and coffee. There is a coffee shop in the lobby open from 6:30 until 2 PM. The vending machine as well as ice was working and filled every time I checked. Nice gift shop is open until 7 with flowers, snacks, etc. There are plenty of options for food during the day including vendor carts right outside the hotel. Dinner is not so easy but cabs are available to take you to a restaurant if your schedule permits. Otherwise the hospital cafeterias are open for dinner until 7:30. McDonalds is right in the CHOP lobby. Parking is at such a premium that having a parking place was very helpful. There are other hotels on the UPenn campus, but this one is much more convenient to the hospitals. The cost including tax and phone charges and parking was $645 for 4 nights-hospital rate-not cheap but being 5 minutes away from my daughter and grandson was so helpful. I could take her clothes each morning so she didn't have to keep everything in the small hospital room. I could take new things each day for him to play with. She could have taken a nap had she chosen to do so. I certainly will stay there again if we have to be at the hospital overnight.

Reviews.Title: “Like staying in a dorm room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice when my child needed medical care at CHOP. We are going to Philadelphia for pleasure on an upcoming weekend and will certainly be staying elsewhere. I didn't find the rooms to be in as poor condition as others who have reviewed it. The convenience to the hospital couldn't be beat and another bonus was that parking was free. I believe we had to pay for parking at the Sheraton. That said the accomodations at the Penn Tower can be likened to a dorm room. It was a place to sleep with few or no amentities, no restaurants/food, no premium TV, none of the little niceties that we often like when staying in hotels. You are on your own here. Bottom line is this hotel is fine if you need to be within very close proximity to the hospital, will spend little time in your room and don't care about having any of the extras. If you are going to Philadelphia for pleasure or will have some extra time on your hands, choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty run down dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In November of 2003 My Father and I stayed at Penn Tower due to it attachment to the Medical Center. The location is the only thing this hotel has going for it. The rooms and hallways are rundown and dirty. There is not a restaurant in this hotel, therefore no room service and I didn't see any vending machines. We had to walk across the street to Mcdonalds late at night to get something to drink. Ridiculous. This hotel would be lucky to get $39.95 a night if it was not attached to the hospital. A total rip off for families already stressed due to health issues. Very Sad.

Reviews.Title: “Phone Response”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on reviews here, I decided to cancel my reservation. However, the toll-free number now directs one to a 900 number, and no one answers the direct line, at least after four hours trying during the middle of a week day.

Reviews.Title: “extremely convenient fo CHOP”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Penn Tower only has a few floors for guests...it is primarily medical offices. When our child needed surgery at Children's Hospital, this hotel was ideal for us. We live 2 hours away from Philly and since most surgeries are now "same-day", this hotel let us keep close to the hospital overnight. It certainly was not resort material, but that wasn't what we were looking for.....knowing that we were just across the street from CHOP was our main priority. For peace of mind, I highly recommend Penn Tower for anyone planning surgery at either CHOP or U. of Penn.

Reviews.Title: “A terrible, run down, dirty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I should have known better after reading the review that called this "an embarrassment to Penn", but I decided to stay at Penn Tower in March, 2003 because I really wanted to be close to HUP, and figured that something owned by such a fine University could not be so bad. But it absolutely was.The room was in terribly shabby condition. The bed was disgusting in that the cheap yellow "blanket" made out of the velour packaging material was filled with holes and was "crunchy" over large places as if sticky liquids had been poured on and dried over several years.The celings and walls had terrible dark water-damage stains and discolorations.The television, in an attempt to save money, has its feed piped in directly from the hospital. So, while you get a few basic cable channels, you are mainly watching Penn Hospital channels, with content created for its patients. One of the few channels was (I kid you not!) the blue display screen from somoeone's computer that read an error message "Read error on Drive D:" 24 hours a day. You can forget about premium channels or in-room movies.The bathroom is indeed extremely run-down with cracks in the sink, and cracks and discolorations in the tub.Another annoyance is that there are no rooms with queen beds. All have two double beds.In terms of services, there are none. There are only 87 rooms, and they don't offer any room service or have any food available within the hotel building. The drink vending machines on my floor was completely sold out, and when I went all the way down the lobby to use the main vending machine, it was completely sold out too.Overall, the experience at the Penn Tower Hotel is the same as what you'd get at an extremely budget motel that disappointed you. But, the Penn Tower does not charge budget prices, and is usually in at least the $150 range, which is about 5 times more than this hotel is worth. If you would like to be near HUP, the Inn at Penn (a 3 block walk) or the Sheraton University City (about a 6-7 block walk) are much much better bets. I booked through a pre-paid site and paid $453 for my 3 nights there, so I was unable to back out once I saw the condition of the room, but please save yourself the generally grimy experience of staying here.
